title: Calories in Wine vs Beer
meta_description: Compare calories in wine vs beer: A standard 5 oz glass of wine has 125 kcal, while a 12 oz beer has 153 kcal. Includes full nutrition, variations, and FAQs.
assumptions: Standard 5 fl oz (148 ml) glass of dry red wine (~12% ABV). Beer comparison to 12 fl oz (355 ml) regular lager (~5% ABV).
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by type, brand, alcohol content, serving size, and additives. Check labels or reliable sources for exact values.

quick_answer.text: A standard 5 oz glass of wine has 125 calories, compared to 153 in a 12 oz beer.

basis.label: per 5 oz glass of dry red wine

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in wine vs beer?
faqs.a: Standard 5 oz wine: 125 kcal; 12 oz beer: 153 kcal. Wine often has fewer calories per serving.

faqs.q: Which has more calories, wine or beer?
faqs.a: Beer typically has more (153 kcal per 12 oz) than wine (125 kcal per 5 oz), but depends on type and size.

faqs.q: Calories in red wine vs white wine?
faqs.a: Similar: red ~125 kcal, white ~120 kcal per 5 oz glass. Reds may have slightly more due to skins.

faqs.q: Does light beer have fewer calories than wine?
faqs.a: Yes, light beer ~100 kcal per 12 oz, less than standard wine's 125 kcal.

faqs.q: How does serving size affect calories in wine vs beer?
faqs.a: Larger pours increase calories proportionally; wine glasses often over 5 oz, beers over 12 oz, raising totals.
